DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no question related to the patient's/participant's consent for the use of blood samples for study use.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient's/participant's consent for the use of blood samples for study use.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Blood circulating throughout the body.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient consent to do
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient consent to donate blood sample

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission for pharmacogenetic testing on her/his blood samples

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF1 Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient agree to have a blood sample collected before starting study drug

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient consent to use of blood samples for research related to this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient consent to use of blood samples for testing related to C-11?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission for blood specimen collection for use in this study.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to give his/her blood sample for research testing

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Your blood may be collected and used for the research study

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: I agree that my blood may be used for research studies to learn about the effects that the experimental treatment may be having.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to give blood sample for research testing

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to provide blood sample(s) to laboratories associated with ACOSOG/Alliance for research testing including genetic sequencing research planned as part of this study.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to provide blood sample(s) to laboratories associated with Alliance for research testing including genetic sequencing research planned as part of this study.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to have blood collected for the optional biology studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to the collection of extra blood samples for the biology research studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to have their blood samples studied for post-InO dose PK?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to have their blood samples studied for B-cell immune function?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient willing to provide fasting blood samples at baseline.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to have their blood samples studied for markers of SOS?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance A212102
ReferenceDocuments.description: Willingness to provide blood samples for research use

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient agree to have additional optional blood samples collected for pharmacokinetic (PK) studies to see the amount of SNDX-5613 in your blood during expansion phase of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to have the blood and bone marrow sent and studied to see if genetic changes can be used to predict how a subject will respond to therapy (Pharmacodynamics)?
